title: The Plagiarized Proposal
setting: Whitmore Consulting, client services floor, Tuesday 11 AM
premise: A winning client proposal was discovered to be plagiarized word-for-word from a competitor's publicly available case study. Someone deliberately replaced the original proposal file on the shared drive at 8:55 PM Monday.

suspects.name: Naomi Fletcher
suspects.motive: Wrote the original proposal and recently learned she's being removed from the account
suspects.alibi: I was at a networking event at the Grand Hotel from 6 PM to 9 PM Monday. I spoke with dozens of people. The event organizer has a sign-in sheet with my name on it.

suspects.name: Rohan Malik
suspects.motive: Wanted Naomi's proposal to fail so his alternative approach would be chosen instead
suspects.alibi: I stayed at the office until about 8 PM working on financial models. Then I drove to the airport to pick up my brother whose flight landed at 9:30 PM from Denver.

suspects.name: Christine Bauer
suspects.motive: Blamed for a previous proposal loss and wants to discredit the team lead
suspects.alibi: I left the office at 5:30 PM and went to my pottery class at the Clay Studio downtown. Class runs from 6 to 8:30 PM every Monday. I have a piece I glazed that night.

suspects.name: James Okafor
suspects.motive: Passed over for a client-facing role and resents the consulting team
suspects.alibi: I left the office at 6 PM and went grocery shopping at FreshMart. I was there for about an hour, then cooked dinner at home. I have the grocery receipt from 6:20 PM.

clues.title: File Modification Log
clues.content: The shared drive audit log shows the proposal was replaced at 8:55 PM Monday from a workstation on the client services floor. The change was made using Rohan's login credentials.

clues.title: Cleaning Staff Observation
clues.content: The cleaning crew member who vacuumed the client services floor at 8:30 PM Monday says she saw one person still at a desk, typing on a computer. She described a man in a blue sweater.

clues.title: Airport Arrival Board
clues.content: The Denver flight that Rohan claims arrived at 9:30 PM was actually delayed and didn't land until 11:15 PM Monday. The delay was posted by the airline at 3 PM that afternoon.

hints.text: Think about who was still in or near the office around 8:55 PM Monday.
Did the airport pickup really require leaving the office when claimed â€” was the flight on time?
